purpleculture_pinyin:
fēng
point of a spear; edge of a tool; vanguard; forward (in sports team)
острие копья; острие инструмента; авангард; нападающий (в спортивной команде)
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 锋)
Pictophonetic: 夆 indicates the sound; 釒 (metal) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 釒 [ jīn ] gold, metal; money
    • 夆 [ féng ] to resist; to headbutt
heisig_chinese_memo: A pointy bit of metal is a sword's cutting edge.
Ru_trainchinese: fēng: (графема) лезвие меча, острие; передовой отряд; (метеорология) фронт
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the gold (金) you'd resist (夆) is at the point of a spear
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: The tools you use to trim your briar must have a sharp metal cutting edge if you want to have an easy time.
humanum_full_description_en:
From " gold " to " every " sound. The original meaning is the tip or sharp point of weapons such as knives and swords. "Shuowen": "鏠, warrior. From gold, every sound." Duan Yucai's note: "Weapon, weapon. Di, the subject of the first birth of things. The extension is the mortal and the end of the common thing, and the common gold The sharp point says 鏠. The vulgar is the front." "Ji Yun. "Zhong Yun": "鏠, or Congzhe." Examples such as "Zhan Guo Ce. "Zhao Cesan": "Furthermore, Wu Qian's sword is harder than the thick spine, but the front is not penetrated; the spleen is thin, but the blade is constant." "Xunzi. "Yibing": "If the sharp edge of Moxie is against it, the one who should be defeated." It also refers to the tip of the artifact. For example, in the Northern Song Dynasty, Shen Kuo's "Mengxi Bi Tan" Volume 24: "The Fang family uses a magnet to sharpen the needle, and you can guide it. "

" Feng " by extension refers to weapons. Such as "Historical Records. Biography of the Marquis of Huaiyin: "Moreover, there are so many people in the world who are sharp and eager to do what your majesty has done, and Gu Li cannot hear it." "Selected Works. Lu Shiheng "Congjunxing": "Flying fronts have no shadows, and Mingdi is in harmony with one another." Lu Xiang's note: "Fengs are also called weapons." "Three Kingdoms. Wu Shu. "Zhou Yu Lu Su Lu Meng Biography": "Before the soldiers confronted, Yu sent Gan and Ning to occupy Yiling."

" Feng " means the forefront and vanguard of the army. Such as "Warring States Policy. "Zhongshan Ce": "Wei Xun and Han Zhirui, want to push forward as the front." Bao Biao's note: "Feng, the army first." "Historical Records. "Ting Bu Lie Biography": "The king of Xiang cuts Qi, and he has a planner, thinking that the soldiers are the first. The king should learn about the people of Huainan, and he will be the forward of the Chu army. Today, 4,000 people are sent to help Chu." . "The Biography of Yuan Shao Liu Biao": "Zan has 30,000 soldiers, listed as Fang Chen, divided into 10,000 horses, winged to the left and right, and the front is very sharp."

" Feng " means sharpness and momentum. Such as "Historical Records. Biography of the Marquis of Huaiyin: "Wen Han will travel Han Xin to the West River, take the king of Wei, and Qin Xia said that the new bloody confession will be supplemented by Zhang's ears, discussing the desire to go to Zhao, this will take advantage of the victory to go to the country, the front is not When." "Wen Xin Diao Long. "The Stele": "Since the Later Han Dynasty, the clouds have risen on the stele; the talented front judged it, Mogao and Cai Yong." Northern Song Su Shi, "Ding Fengbo": "The guest and the host talk about who is like the front. Look, Cao Liujin treats two Su Zhang."

" Feng " is also an ancient farm tool. "On Heng. "Xing Ou": "The gold of waiting is either a sword or a halberd, or a front." Yuan Dynasty Wang Zhen's "Nongshu" Volume 13: "Feng, ancient agricultural tools. Its gold is smaller and sharper than a plow. Its handle is like a lei, and the first is like a blade, hence the name “ front ”, whichever is sharp.” The extension indicates the action of turning the ground with a “ front ”, as in "Qi Min Yao Shu. "Plowing the Field": "After the autumn harvest, the ox is weak, and those who plough in the autumn before the harvest, under the grain, millet, scorpion, beam, and scorpion, that is, the rapid front, the ground is constant and moist but not hard."

" Feng " is also the same as " bee ", which means many and groups. Such as "Han Shu. "Guyong Du Ye Biography": "Twenty years since the founding of the first year, the mass disasters have been very different, and the fronts have crossed, more than those written in the Spring and Autumn Period." Emperor Guangwu: "In the end, the world continues to plague locusts, and the bandits rise up." Li Xian's note: "Feng, the word or bee." "The Family Instructions of Yan Family. "Yinci": "After this, the sound and rhyme come out, each with its own local customs, and each other is not a smile. It refers to the Ma Zhiyu, and I don't know which one is."
humanum_short_description_en: From " gold " to " every " sound. The original meaning is the tip or sharp point of weapons such as knives and swords.
humanum_full_description:
從「金」，「逢」聲。本義是刀、劍等兵器的尖端或銳利處。《說文》：「鏠，兵耑也。从金，逢聲。」段玉裁注：「兵，械也。耑，物初生之題。引申為凡物之顚與末、凡金器之尖曰鏠。俗作鋒。」《集韻．鍾韻》：「鏠，或从夆。」例子如《戰國策．趙策三》：「且夫吳干之劍材，難夫毋脊之厚，而鋒不入；無脾之薄，而刃不斷。」《荀子．議兵》：「兌則若莫邪之利鋒，當之者潰。」又泛指器物的尖端，如北宋沈括《夢溪筆談》卷24：「方家以磁石磨針鋒，則能指南。」

　　「鋒」引申指兵器。如《史記．淮陰侯列傳》：「且天下銳精持鋒欲為陛下所為者甚眾，顧力不能耳。」《文選．陸士衡〈從軍行〉》：「飛鋒無絕影，鳴鏑自相和。」呂向注：「鋒，謂兵刃也。」《三國志．吳書．周瑜魯肅呂蒙傳》：「兵未交鋒，瑜即遣甘寧前據夷陵。」

　　「鋒」表示軍隊的前列、先頭部隊。如《戰國策．中山策》：「魏恃韓之銳，欲推以為鋒。」鮑彪注：「鋒，軍之先。」《史記．黥布列傳》：「項王伐齊，身負板築，以為士卒先，大王宜悉淮南之眾，身自將之，為楚軍前鋒，今迺發四千人以助楚。」《後漢書．袁紹劉表列傳》：「瓚兵三萬，列為方陳，分突騎萬匹，翼軍左右，其鋒甚銳。」

　　「鋒」表示鋒芒、勢頭。如《史記．淮陰侯列傳》：「聞漢將韓信涉西河，虜魏王，禽夏說，新喋血閼與，今乃輔以張耳，議欲下趙，此乘勝而去國遠鬭，其鋒不可當。」《文心雕龍．誄碑》：「自後漢以來，碑碣雲起；才鋒所斷，莫高蔡邕。」北宋蘇軾〈定風波〉：「賓主談鋒誰得似，看取，曹劉今對兩蘇張。」

　　「鋒」亦是古農具。《論衡．幸偶》：「等之金也，或為劍戟，或為鋒銛。」元代王禎《農書》卷13：「鋒，古農器也。其金比犁鑱小而加銳，其柄如耒，首如刃鋒，故名鋒，取其銛利也。」引申表示用「鋒」翻地的動作，如《齊民要術．耕田》：「凡秋收之後，牛力弱，未及即秋耕者，穀、黍、穄、粱、秫茇之下，即移羸速鋒之，地恆潤澤而不堅硬。」

　　「鋒」又同「蜂」，表示眾多、成群。如《漢書．谷永杜鄴傳》：「建始元年以來二十載間，群災大異，交錯鋒起，多於春秋所書。」《後漢書．光武帝紀上》：「莽末，天下連歲災蝗，寇盜鋒起。」李賢注：「鋒，字或作蜂。」《顏氏家訓．音辭》：「茲厥後，音韻鋒出，各有土風，遞相非笑，指馬之諭，未知孰是。」
humanum_short_description: 從「金」，「逢」聲。本義是刀、劍等兵器的尖端或銳利處。

Pictophonetic: 夆 indicates the sound; 釒 (metal) conveys the meaning.

    • 夆 [ féng ] to resist; to headbutt

Chinese: A pointy bit of metal is a sword's cutting edge.
Meaning: cutting edge
Hanzi: 锋
Story: The tools you use to trim your briar must have a sharp metal cutting edge if you want to have an easy time.
Kind: traditional

從「 金 」，「 逢 」聲。本義是刀、劍等兵器的尖端或銳利處。《說文》：「鏠，兵耑也。从金，逢聲。」段玉裁注：「兵，械也。耑，物初生之題。引申為凡物之顚與末、凡金器之尖曰鏠。俗作鋒。」《集韻．鍾韻》：「鏠，或从夆。」例子如《戰國策．趙策三》：「且夫吳干之劍材，難夫毋脊之厚，而鋒不入；無脾之薄，而刃不斷。」《荀子．議兵》：「兌則若莫邪之利鋒，當之者潰。」又泛指器物的尖端，如北宋沈括《夢溪筆談》卷24：「方家以磁石磨針鋒，則能指南。」 「 鋒 」引申指兵器。如《史記．淮陰侯列傳》：「且天下銳精持鋒欲為陛下所為者甚眾，顧力不能耳。」《文選．陸士衡〈從軍行〉》：「飛鋒無絕影，鳴鏑自相和。」呂向注：「鋒，謂兵刃也。」《三國志．吳書．周瑜魯肅呂蒙傳》：「兵未交鋒，瑜即遣甘寧前據夷陵。」 「 鋒 」表示軍隊的前列、先頭部隊。如《戰國策．中山策》：「魏恃韓之銳，欲推以為鋒。」鮑彪注：「鋒，軍之先。」《史記．黥布列傳》：「項王伐齊，身負板築，以為士卒先，大王宜悉淮南之眾，身自將之，為楚軍前鋒，今迺發四千人以助楚。」《後漢書．袁紹劉表列傳》：「瓚兵三萬，列為方陳，分突騎萬匹，翼軍左右，其鋒甚銳。」 「 鋒 」表示鋒芒、勢頭。如《史記．淮陰侯列傳》：「聞漢將韓信涉西河，虜魏王，禽夏說，新喋血閼與，今乃輔以張耳，議欲下趙，此乘勝而去國遠鬭，其鋒不可當。」《文心雕龍．誄碑》：「自後漢以來，碑碣雲起；才鋒所斷，莫高蔡邕。」北宋蘇軾〈定風波〉：「賓主談鋒誰得似，看取，曹劉今對兩蘇張。」 「 鋒 」亦是古農具。《論衡．幸偶》：「等之金也，或為劍戟，或為鋒銛。」元代王禎《農書》卷13：「鋒，古農器也。其金比犁鑱小而加銳，其柄如耒，首如刃鋒，故名鋒，取其銛利也。」引申表示用「 鋒 」翻地的動作，如《齊民要術．耕田》：「凡秋收之後，牛力弱，未及即秋耕者，穀、黍、穄、粱、秫茇之下，即移羸速鋒之，地恆潤澤而不堅硬。」 「 鋒 」又同「 蜂 」，表示眾多、成群。如《漢書．谷永杜鄴傳》：「建始元年以來二十載間，群災大異，交錯鋒起，多於春秋所書。」《後漢書．光武帝紀上》：「莽末，天下連歲災蝗，寇盜鋒起。」李賢注：「鋒，字或作蜂。」《顏氏家訓．音辭》：「茲厥後，音韻鋒出，各有土風，遞相非笑，指馬之諭，未知孰是。」

Liushutong characters (1)

鋒字的基本解释

鋒
fēng
见“锋”。

鋒字的汉语字典释义

[①]［fēng］
［《廣韻》敷容切，平鍾，敷。］
“锋1”的繁体字。亦作“鏠1”。亦作“1”。
(1)刀、剑等有刃的兵器的尖端或锐利部分。
(2)借指刀、剑等有刃的兵器。
(3)指器物的尖端。
(4)尖锐；锐利。参见“鋒石”、“鋒戈”。
(5)军队的前列。
(6)锋芒、势头。
(7)古农具名。
(8)指以锋翻地。
(9)气象名词。参见“鋒面”、“鋒綫”。
(10)通“蜂”。参见“鋒至”。
(11)通“蜂”。成群地。参见“鋒起”。
(12)通“豐”。参见“鋒殺”。
(13)用同“烽”。参见“鋒火”。

鋒字的康熙字典解释

【戌集上】【金字部】　鋒； 康熙笔画：15； 页码：页1307第12
【唐韻】【集韻】【韻會】?敷容切，音丰。【說文】兵耑也。本作鏠。省作鋒。【釋名】刀其末曰鋒，言若鋒刺之毒利也。　又【前漢·東方朔傳】變詐鋒起。【荀子·王制篇】嘗試之說鋒起。【註】如鋒刃齊起而難犯。　又軍之前列。【前漢·黥布傳】布爲前鋒。　又星名。【史記·天官書】斗杓端有兩星，一內爲矛招搖，一外爲盾天鋒。　又國名。【史記·五帝紀】帝嚳娶?鋒氏女，生放勳。【正義】作?豐。　又劒名。【典論】寶劒有三，其二曰華鋒。

鋒字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形

fēng

Front
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［fēng］
["Guangyun" apply Rongqi, Pingzhong, apply. ]
Traditional characters of "锋1". Also known as "鏠1". Also known as "1".
(1) The tip or sharp part of bladed weapons such as knives and swords.
(2) By means of bladed weapons such as knives and swords.
(3) Refers to the tip of the utensil.
(4) Sharp; sharp. See "Feng Shi", "Feng Ge".
(5) The forefront of the army.
(6) Sharpness and momentum.
(7) Ancient farm tool names.
(8) Refers to turning the ground with a front.
(9) Meteorological terms. See "front", "front".
(10) Through "bee". See "Feng Zhi".
(11) Through "bee". In groups. See "Feng Qi".
(12) Through "Feng". See "Fight Kill".
(13) Use the same as "Feng". See "Fenghuo".
Front
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Su Ji 1] [Golden Word Department] 　feng; Kangxi strokes: 15; page number: page 1307-12
[Tang Yun] [Ji Yun] [Rhyme Meeting]? Fu Rong Qi, sound abundant. [Said the text] Soldiers also. This is a feast. Provincial as the front. [Release name] The end of a knife is called Feng, and if a sharp sting is poisonous and profitable.　[Previous Han·Dongfang Shuo Chuan] turned into a bluff. [Xunzi·Wang Zhi Chapter] Try to talk about it. [Note] It's hard to commit a crime like a sharp edge.　Before the army again. [Former Han·Tingbu Biography] Bu is a striker.　Also star name. [Historical Records·Book of Heavenly Officials] There are two stars at the end of the bucket, one is the spear swagger, and the other is the shield Tianfeng.　 Also the name of the country. 【Historical Records·Five Emperors】Emperor Yu married a daughter of Feng's family and gave birth to Xun. [Justice] Make abundance.　 Another name. [Classic Theory] There are three treasures, and the second is Huafeng.
